manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a cupboard and a plate. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry, a living room and a hallway here.

No, probably the pillow and book are in the kitchen cupboard itself. So after opening it, I can pick them up. Once I have both, I can move towards placing each on the table. Since each action allows only one object placement, I might need to do this separately for each item.

Alternatively, maybe there's a more efficient way if I can carry two items at once. But in the rules, it says I can have up to two objects in my inventory simultaneously. I think each time you pick an object, it becomes part of your inventory, and you can only carry two at a time. Hmm, perhaps I should just proceed with opening the cupboard first and see what happens. That seems like a logical starting point.
